findings.reasoning: This finding identifies a real vulnerability (double increment of ticketsCount) that leads to a concrete attack scenario (50% chance of subpot locking). It is not the TARGET vulnerability but meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: exists in code, has a concrete exploit, no trusted role required, and results in loss of funds.

This finding identifies a real vulnerability (gas exhaustion due to large buyers array) with a concrete attack scenario (attacker creates many unique buyers to cause cash() to revert). It is not the TARGET vulnerability but meets all BONUS_VALID criteria.

This finding identifies a real vulnerability (blockhash availability limited to last 256 blocks) with a concrete attack scenario (attacker can become first buyer and wait to cash after 256 blocks). It is not the TARGET vulnerability but meets all BONUS_VALID criteria.

This finding identifies a real vulnerability (remainder funds left unclaimable due to flooring in subpot calculation) with a concrete attack scenario (funds stuck in contract). It is not the TARGET vulnerability but meets all BONUS_VALID criteria.

notes: None of the findings match the TARGET vulnerability (unchecked_return in cash function). The TARGET vulnerability's root cause (unchecked return value of low-level call) was not identified in any finding. All findings are valid but unrelated to the TARGET.
